conclusion: Analyze the image and use given information about the prism and refractive index to determine the angle between emergent and incident light.

The image shows a prism with an equilateral triangular cross-section. A beam of white light is incident from point M with an angle α = 60°. The refractive index of the material for red light is given as n = √3.
The prism has an equilateral triangular cross-section, meaning all angles inside the triangle are 60°.
The incident angle α is given as 60°.
Calculate the critical angle θc using sin(θc) = 1/n. With n = √3, sin(θc) = 1/√3, giving θc = 30°.
Calculate the angle of deviation for red light as Δ = θc - α = 30° - 60° = 30°.
The angle between the emergent light and the incident light is the angle of deviation, which is 30°.
